Project: City Year Los Angeles Expansion into two PLAS High Schools: Jordan and Roosevelt
Organization(s): City Year Los Angeles| Partnership for LA Schools
Description: City Year Los Angeles and Partnership for LA Schools will expand by offering one-on-one mentorship to Roosevelt High School in Boyle Heights and Jordan High School in Watts.

Project: Thriving in a Hotter Los Angeles—100% Sustainability by 2050
Description: UCLA Grand Challenges will publish a draft work plan to transform the LA region to 100% sustainability in water and energy by 2050.

Project: Special Olympics World Games 2015
Description: The Special Olympics will build capacity to recruit 30,000 volunteers for the World Games in LA in 2015.

Project: Kids Play at Pershing Square
Description: The Pershing Square Park Advisory Council will re-establish Pershing Square as the “Living Room” of Downtown Los Angeles and install two playgrounds at the corner of 6th and Olive.

Project: Streetcraft LA
Description: StreetCraft LA will empower low income, at risk, and unemployed youth to improve their economic future through creative economy entrepreneurship.

Project: Incubator School Programs + Playbook: Open Source 21st Century Entrepreneurial Education
Description: The Incubator School will build an open source entrepreneurial education for the 21st century.

Project: Avalon Green Alley Demonstration Project
Description: The Trust for Public Land will transform trash-filled alleys in South Los Angeles into walkable, bikeable, beautiful green alleys.

Project: Dream Big With @movelatransit
Description: MoveLA will seed a countywide public conversation around public transportation with a digital media platform and strategy.

Project: 75 School Gardens in Los Angeles Schools!
Description: EnrichLA will reach our goal of building 75 school gardens, and will offer their Garden Ranger Program to at least 5,500 additional students.

Project: We Are All LA: a socially conscious business network to end women's homelessness through jobs
Description: Downtown Women’s Center will leverage the power of for-profit/non-profit partnerships to work toward ending homelessness for women in Los Angeles through job training and placement.

Project: Arts ReSTORE LA: Westwood. An Urban Renewal Project
Description: The Hammer Museum will utilize $100,000 to curate an artisanal pop-up village in Westwood and offer a long term strategy to turn the neighborhood around.

Project: 1,000 Mentors for Students: Build a Greater City of Angels
Description: 826LA will inspire over 1,000 Angelenos to volunteer and help students across Los Angeles to make great leaps in learning.

Project: Transforming Empty Space Through Collaboration and Empowerment
Organization(s): Community Health Councils| C-Lab (Columbia University)| 596 Acres
Description: Community Health Councils, C-Lab (Columbia University), and 596 Acres’ LA Open Acres Project will facilitate the transformation of the city’s thousands of acres of vacant and underutilized lands into vibrant green, public places that contribute to the health and well-being of local residents.

Project: Market Makeovers: NextGen Leaders
Description: Public Matters has been greening food deserts through Market Makeovers since 2007 – one corner store at a time.

Project: Affordable Homes, Sustainable Neighborhoods
Description: TRUST South LA is working to create affordable homes for local families, with a plan to make better use of the 3000 acres of underutilized land in South LA.

Project: LA Street Vendors: A Better Economy through Low-Income Entrepreneurs
Organization(s): East LA Community Corporation (ELACC)| Leadership for Urban Renewal Now (LURN)
Description: ELACC & LURN will provide working capital that will help support the growth of LA’s approximately 10,000 street vendors.

Project: Hope Has An Address
Description: Homeboy Industries proposes to improve public safety through an integrated curriculum of ten classes that help end the intergenerational cycles of violence that many former gang members and recently incarcerated men and women have experienced.

Project: Get Connected LA
Description: CicLAvia – an event where the streets are “owned” by the pedestrians and cyclists – aspires to become a monthly event and an integral part of a transit rich, culturally engaged, and economically thriving future LA.

Project: Building on LA's Social Capital
Description: Mission Asset Fund proposes to bring Lending Circles for Citizenship and the Security Deposit Loan Program for the first time to Southern California.

Project: The Salamander Project: Re-designing Creativity in Education
Organization(s): No Right Brain Left Behind| Green Dot Public Schools
Description: No Right Brain Left Behind and Green Dot Public Schools’ Salamander Project will transform a neglected library at Locke High School into an Innovation Space while developing the HackerSpace in a Box ‘Creativity Generator’ to foster students’ exploration, critical thinking, and collaborative problem solving.
